fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

It is not possible to set a workflow property to customise Archive Issue Permission. For example via:
 * {{jira.permission.archive.denied = denied}} _or_
 * {{jira.permission.archive.user = username_to_allow}}

*Root cause*

When the Archive issue feature was added, we did not add the appropriate entry within the Jira API Project Permission definition to allow the get "Short Name" method of ProjectPermissions.java to resolve the ARCHIVE_ISSUES project permission

Therefore, calls to {{systemProjectPermissionKeyByShortName()}} (which is used by Workflow Properties to specify which project permission it is) does not know which permission to use for "archive", therefore, we are not able to specify a workflow property to disallow archiving at a particular workflow step.

*Notes:*
 * See ARCHIVE_ISSUES implemented in the project permission jira-components/jira-core/src/main/java/com/atlassian/jira/plugin/permission/ProjectPermissionModuleDescriptorImpl.java
 * But not implemented on the API side here - jira-components/jira-api/src/main/java/com/atlassian/jira/permission/ProjectPermissions.java

h3. Steps to Reproduce

In a workflow step, specify a Workflow Property such as {{jira.permission.archive.denied = denied}}
h3. Expected Results

The workflow property takes effect on that particular step and disallows archiving
h3. Actual Results

No effect
h3. Workaround

Currently there is no known workaround for this behavior. A workaround will be added here when available
fields.summary: Unable to specify "Archive" permission via workflow properties

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition
 * As a Jira user I want to export my issues to csv to use as reports for monitoring or for use in some meetings.
 * I don't need to include all the comments but I want to include specifically the "last comment" in my report.

h3. Suggested Solution
 * Provide the option to export comments through the built-in exporter.
 * include the feature to select specifically "Last comment" similarly to this third part app [[https://marketplace.atlassian.com/apps/15064/ccc-last-comment?hosting=server&tab=overview]].

h3. Why this is important
 * This gives a better overview of the issue and the progress of work when the exporter is used to generate reports.

h3. Workaround
 * Currently there is no workaround to export only the last comment from Jira issues.
fields.summary: Export last comment to CSV or Excel

fields.description:

On newer Jira versions, when a user navigates to {{Project Settings > Users and roles > Edit defaults}} to change the Project Lead, this field is presented as a dropdown list with no options.

Present it as a regular user picker field.

fields.summary: Edit project lead section on Jira is presented as a dropdown field with no options

fields.description:
*Issue Summary:*

In a field using the Wiki style renderer, if a user adds a table, code block, preformatted block or panel at the bottom of the page, the field will not display or jump to the bottom, but add the element below its visible bottom.

*To reproduce:*
 # Create a new issue or go to an existing issue that has a field with Wiki style renderer.
 # Insert text until the scroll bar appears
 # Add any of the following:
 ## Table
 ## Code
 ## Preformatted
 ## Panel

*Expected results:*

The field will automatically scroll down to where the cursor is; specifically, the bottom of the field.

*Actual results:*

The inserted element is inserted _below_ the bottom of the *visible* field. The cursor is hidden, and the field does not scroll down.

*Workaround:*

The user must scroll down manually after adding any of the mentioned elements to see what they have most recently added to the field.
fields.summary: Wiki style renderer: Elements inserted outside visible range of field

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

Bulk Move operation does not retain All the users (or existing active users) if the User Picker (multiple users) custom field contains any inactive users.
 Proceeding further with Bulk move provides a retain checkbox, but even after selecting that the presented user fields will be empty and continuing would 
 overwrite this field with empty values in the target project's issue.
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Create Project A, Project B
 # Create users test1, test2 in Project A.
 # Create a Custom Field CC Users with User Picker (multiple users) and add to Project A
 # Create a test issue and add test1, test2 to CC users.
 # Go to User management and Inactivate the user "test1"
 # Perform the Bulk Move operation with Retain Checkbox option selected for CC Users

h3. Expected Results

Issue moved to Target project with all the Users (or Active users) retained.
h3. Actual Results
CC Users will be empty.

h3. Workaround
 # Make the inactive users active again and perform the Bulk Move of issues. Once it is completed Inactivate the users again.
 # Please test this in a test environment before proceeding further. Also as per [Atlassian Support Offerings|https://confluence.atlassian.com/support/atlassian-support-offerings-193299636.html] we would not be able to provide the extended support
 on this as it is related to altering database values.
{code:sql}
SELECT * from cwd_user u join cwd_directory d on u.directory_id = d.id where u.active = 0; --(This is to check the inactive users)

 select * from  public.customfieldvalue where stringvalue in (select user_key from app_user a, cwd_directory d, cwd_user u where d.id=u.directory_id and a.id=u.id and u.active=0) ; --(This is to identify Inactive users associated with Jira issue from CC Users field)

 delete from public.customfieldvalue where stringvalue in (select user_key from app_user a, cwd_directory d, cwd_user u where d.id=u.directory_id and a.id=u.id and u.active=0) ; --(Deleting these entries would result in successful Move of the issues as all the Active Users are retained as it is){code}
fields.summary: Bulk Move operation does not retain All the users (or existing active users) if the User Picker (multiple users) custom field contains any inactive users.

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
The Message-ID of new and update notifications for an issue is different with MySQL 5.6 and later
h5. A message-id of the new notification email:
{code}
Message-ID: <JIRA.10026.1563869260000.3.1563869280205@Atlassian.JIRA>
In-Reply-To: <JIRA.10026.1563869260000@Atlassian.JIRA>
References: <JIRA.10026.1563869260000@Atlassian.JIRA> <JIRA.10026.1563869260650@mysql>
{code}
h5. A message-id of the update notification email:
{code}
Message-ID: <JIRA.10026.1563869261000.4.1563869400175@Atlassian.JIRA>
In-Reply-To: <JIRA.10026.1563869261000@Atlassian.JIRA>
References: <JIRA.10026.1563869261000@Atlassian.JIRA> <JIRA.10026.1563869261000@mysql>
{code}

*1563869260000* becomes *1563869261000* .  it is a different 1000.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Create an issue. and check the message-id of the notification email
 # Update the issue. and check the message-id of the notification email.

h3. Expected Results
The message-id is same

h3. Actual Results
The message-id is not the same

This issue happens with MySQL 5.6 and later.
MySQL 5.6 has fractional seconds support from MySQL 5.6
https://dev.mysql.com/doc/refman/5.6/en/fractional-seconds.html

Check the DB recode
{code}
select unix_timestamp(created) from jiraissue;
{code}

The corresponding data is *1563869261* on the DB at the time it was registered to the DB.
We believe this is because the created column has no decimals and has been rounded to the nearest decimal point and carried forward.
When creating a message-ID, milliseconds are truncated, but when storing the original time in the DB, milliseconds are rounded up and registered in the DB.
At the time of update, because the date and time referenced from the DB are used, it becomes the one that is carried forward, so it is seen that this phenomenon occurs as a result of the difference of 1000.
The milliseconds are truncated to *499ms or less* , so it just so happens to work as before.

h3. Workaround
no workaround at this moment
fields.summary: The Message-ID of new and update notifications for an issue is different with MySQL 5.6 and later

	at com.atlassian.jira.security.JiraSecurityFilter.doFilter(JiraSecurityFilter.java:64)
	... 39 filtered
	at com.atlassian.jira.servermetrics.CorrelationIdPopulatorFilter.doFilter(CorrelationIdPopulatorFilter.java:30)
	... 10 filtered

fields.description:
As a Jira Administrator, I want to limit the fields that users are able to Bulk Update so that I can preserve data integrity of calculated, read-only, or other system-generated fields.

We have several system-generated fields that are "read-only" for users, and others that we don't want users to be able to modify once an issue reaches a certain state. Bulk Update allows users to bypass the controls we have implemented and edit any field value. We would like the ability to restrict the list of fields available in the Bulk Update operation.

(Similar to JRACLOUD-34281)
fields.summary: Ability to restrict field list in Bulk Update
Update page: Creating a test environment for Jira

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
REST API for statuses does not work if its name contains forward slash

h3. Steps to Reproduce
Perform a GET request using CURL, Postman or directly in the web browser to <JIRA Base URL>/rest/api/2/status/\{StatusName} , where status name contains the character "/" For example: "Peer review / change manager approval".

h3. Expected Results
According to documentation for the endpoint [Get Status|https://docs.atlassian.com/software/jira/docs/api/REST/7.6.1/#api/2/status-getStatus], the status information should be retrieved.

h3. Actual Results
An error 400 is returned  !image-2020-05-05-21-44-37-244.png|thumbnail! 

Example: Having the name "Peer review / change manager approval", which encoded to URL is "Peer%20review%20%2F%20change%20manager%20approval", the entire URL would be: 
{code:java}
<JIRA BASE URL>/rest/api/2/status/Peer%20review%20%2F%20change%20manager%20approval{code}

and this produces an error 400.

h3. Workaround
Use the ID instead of the name
fields.summary: REST API for statuses does not work if its name contains forward slash

fields.description:

!image-2020-05-05-13-07-33-641.png!

On the other hand, while choosing i.e. the assignee for an issue the user is refered by his lower_user_name

!image-2020-05-05-13-07-15-461.png!

 

 

Shouldn't it be possible to design this consistently? We would like to show the lower_user_name in every occasion in Jira.
fields.summary: Show lower_user_name instead of user_key in Jira UI

h3. Expected Results
* CPU/Memory/Uptime information to be displayed:

h3. Actual Results

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition
Identifying which parent Epic a Story issue is associated with on a Kanban board is not always straightforward.  While you can add the Epic Label to the cards, it won't necessarily contain enough information in the truncated lozenge to identify the parent Epic sometimes.  It's the same if, by some chance, you have two Epics with the same name and color.

h3. Suggested Solution
One possible solution to get around this is to crop the cards and add the parent Epic issue link at the top; similar to Subtasks.
fields.summary: Increase visibility of Epic-Story associations in Kanban board
Two Dimensional Filter with Epic Link and filter on issuetype generates large JQL query

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition
When all stories associated with an Epic are closed, you must take extra steps to close the parent Epic.  

h3. Suggested Solution
While some architectures might want to continue using Epics the way they are designed, it would be more seamless in some cases if there was an option which enabled a prompt when you close the last Story in an Epic; similar to how closing the last Subtask of a Story works.
fields.summary: Prompt to close Epic when all Stories are closed

fields.description:
While viewing a Jira issue, there is a "# pull requests" link (where "#" is the number of pull requests). Clicking this opens a pop-up with the list of the pull requests.

However, these pull requests do not show which repository they have been made in. Since the pull request name will often be the same as the Jira issue name, they are often all identical. The only way to know which repository each pull request is for is to follow each link and look there.

I would love to have the repository name be listed along with the pull request name, id, etc.

 !jira-issue-pull-request-list-no-repository-names.png|thumbnail!
fields.summary: Show repository name on pull request list on Jira issue

fields.description:

Installing or upgrading "Automation for Jira - Server Lite" fails silently.  
 * When installing through UPM > Find New apps in Marketplace, the process hangs. 
 * When installing through UPM > Upload an app, the process hangs.  
 * When upgrading to this version, the upgrade appears to complete, but the app version doesn't actually update.  

h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Attempt to install or update Automation Lite for Jira version 7.1.12.

h3. Expected Results

The app installs or updates. 
h3. Actual Results

The apps does not install or update. 

The below exception is thrown in the atlassian-jira.log file:
{noformat}
2020-05-04 13:57:08,469-0500 UpmAsynchronousTaskManager:thread-4 WARN /rest/plugins/1.0/installed-marketplace [c.a.p.osgi.factory.OsgiPluginFactory] Found plugin key 'com.atlassian.plugin.automation.jira-automation-plugin' in the manifest but no bundle version, so it can't be loaded as an OsgiPlugin

2020-05-04 13:57:08,511-0500 UpmAsynchronousTaskManager:thread-4 WARN  0:0:0:0:0:0:0:1 /rest/plugins/1.0/installed-marketplace [c.a.p.osgi.factory.OsgiPluginFactory] Found plugin key 'com.atlassian.plugin.automation.jira-automation-plugin' in the manifest but no bundle version, so it can't be loaded as an OsgiPlugin
2020-05-04 13:57:08,516-0500 UpmAsynchronousTaskManager:thread-4 WARN  0:0:0:0:0:0:0:1 /rest/plugins/1.0/installed-marketplace [c.a.p.osgi.factory.OsgiPluginFactory] Found plugin key 'com.atlassian.plugin.automation.jira-automation-plugin' in the manifest but no bundle version, so it can't be loaded as an OsgiPlugin
2020-05-04 13:57:08,681-0500 UpmAsynchronousTaskManager:thread-4 ERROR  0:0:0:0:0:0:0:1 /rest/plugins/1.0/installed-marketplace [c.a.plugin.loaders.ScanningPluginLoader] Unable to deploy plugin 'com.atlassian.plugin.automation.jira-automation-plugin' from 'Unit: jira-home\atlassian-jira-software-8.5.4\plugins\installed-plugins\plugin.1566185343515634078.automation-for-jira-lite-7.1.12.jar (1588618628474)'.

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
Archived flag is incorrect in Webhook for Version Updated

h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Setup a webhook on 'Project related events' > 'Version' > 'Updated'.
 # Go to Project settings > Versions, and *archive* the version.

h3. Expected Results
The webhook shows the information of the version, including the archived flag as "true".

h3. Actual Results
The webhook shows the information of the version, including the archived flag as "false", 

When archiving: {code}"root":
"timestamp": 1588575949950
"webhookEvent": "jira:version_updated"
"version":
"self": "http://localhost:8080/rest/api/2/version/10002"
"id": "10002"
"name": "Version 3.0"
"archived": false
"released": false
"overdue": false
"projectId": 10000{code}

It seems the information is retrieved from before the change was made, as unarchiving a version will trigger the webhook and the flag archived will be "true" this time:

When unarchiving: {code}"root":
"timestamp": 1588576776765
"webhookEvent": "jira:version_updated"
"version":
"self": "http://localhost:8080/rest/api/2/version/10002"
"id": "10002"
"name": "Version 3.0"
"archived": true
"released": false
"overdue": false
"projectId": 10000{code}

h3. Workaround
 Currently there is no known workaround for this behavior. A workaround will be added here when available
fields.summary: Archived flag is incorrect in Webhook for Version Updated

fields.description:
Hi,
after a short discussion with Ben Magro we will open this request.

Our Customer Unicredit (their security department) is requesting the following:

"There  should be the following log in Jira, if a Jira user sees on a Jira screen GDPR related user data from others (like full name or email)....
This should be independant from read, modiy or delete access….So log file should be like : ” user x has seen the following data from other users  on Jira screen by doing the following acitivity (read,modify,delete)."

Is this something on the roadmap and what could be the answer to the customer?

Many thanks
fields.summary: Enhanced Auditing to see which GDPR related data was seen on Jira screenss

fields.description:
Whenever a customer unsubscribes himself from a Jira notification it is difficult for a Jira admin to troubleshoot why the emails are not being sent to that customer from a Jira instance. A customer might have unsubscribed sometime back to avoid the noise and after a while when he wants to know the updates on the issue, its difficult to backtrack and find why this customer is not receiving any email notifications. This at the moment is possible only by running SQL queries on the backend.
If there is a UI feature that says which customer or agent has unsubscribed from emails from a particular email handler, it would save time in analyzing the complete flow.
fields.summary: Notify Jira Admin if a Customer has unsubscribed from the Email Notification

fields.description:
I use Jira User Server connected to our Active Directory to pull in users for a specific department.  Our confluence instance uses the Jira connection to also grant access to Confluence.  This is handy so that user directories for Confluence and Jira are all just handled in Jira.  

I'd like however, to be able to fine tune which users are enabled/disabled (counting toward license) locally from Jira instead of relying on IT Department to remove them from the Active Directory security group.  They have a practice, as most do I believe of just moving users who have left into an archived group so that ex-employees continue to take up license slots unless I get IT (which is really slow) to remove the AD security group.

My feature request is that, users imported into Jira User Server can be enabled/disabled from within Jira Administration and that the User Directory LDAP integration (Optionally) just be an authentication platform. This seems like it would be entirely possible, as Jira can also manage users locally.
fields.summary: Enable/Disable Users - Fine tune users from Active Directory/LDAP
Having outdated Team Management plugin installed causes REST API to stop working

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

A quick search of a text that contains _ when the indexing and user profile language is set to German not giving any results
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Navigate to *Jira administration > System* > under "*Import and Export"* choose "*External System Import"*
 # Import the attached *CSV* file with *description* and *summary*
 # Navigate to *Jira administration > System* > under "*General configuration*" clock on *"Edit settings*" and set the language to *English*.
 # In "*Quick Search*" in top navigation bar type in "*Export_ISP_BR*" when the indexing and User profile language is set to *English*, you will see the issue results
 # Navigate to *Jira administration* > *System* > under "*General configuration*" click on "*Edit settings*" and set the language to *German*.
 # Again in "*Quick Search*" type in "*Export_ISP_BR"* when the indexing and User profile language is set to *German*, you will see no issue results and it shows "*No issues were found to match your search*".

h3. Expected Results

The results should be the same no matter to which the profile language is set to.
h3. Actual Results
 * When the language is set to English it's returning 3 issues.
 * When language is set to German it's displaying that "No issues were found to match your search"

h3. Workaround

Currently, there is no known workaround for this behavior except changing the profile language to English. A workaround will be added here when available
fields.summary: Quick search of a text that contains _ when the indexing and user profile language is set to German not giving any results

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

The recently disclosed vulnerabilities regarding Apache Tomcat

* [CVE-2020-1935|https://cve.mitre.org/cgi-bin/cvename.cgi?name=CVE-2020-1935]
* [CVE-2019-17569|https://cve.mitre.org/cgi-bin/cvename.cgi?name=CVE-2019-17569]
* [CVE-2020-1938|https://cve.mitre.org/cgi-bin/cvename.cgi?name= CVE-2020-1938]


Which affects the following versions:

    Apache Tomcat 8.x from 8.5.0 before 8.5.51

We should bundle a more recent version of Tomcat so that Jira is not affected by this in the future.

h3. Steps to Reproduce

* Not applicable.

h3. Expected Results

* Not applicable.

h3. Actual Results

* Not applicable.

h3. Workaround

* Manually upgrade Tomcat according to our [documentation|https://confluence.atlassian.com/jirakb/how-to-upgrade-apache-tomcat-version-used-by-jira-879957866.html].
fields.summary: The version of Apache Tomcat included with Jira Server is affected by CVE-2020-1935, CVE-2020-1938, CVE-2019-17569

fields.description:
When you feed a filter to the Two Dimensional Filter Statistics gadget, the results are divided into sections, that will display the results found for each axis defined in the filter properties. As we can see in the screenshots below:

 !Screen Shot 2020-04-30 at 04.31.04.png|thumbnail! 

 !Screen Shot 2020-04-30 at 04.24.56.png|thumbnail! 

You can click on the number of results to display the complete list of issues found. However, when you click on these sections, the majority of them will not display the information using the *Columns* settings defined by the filter. Instead, most of the sections will display the *Column* configuration selected by the user, under the *My defaults* option.

Below we can see a screenshot of the gadget and all the circled sections will display the results while applying the user-configured *Column* configuration, where we would expect to see the same *Column* configuration displayed by the filter used on the gadget:

 !Screen Shot 2020-04-30 at 03.53.15.png|thumbnail! 

It would be beneficial if the Two Dimensional Filter Statistics gadget displayed the results applying the *Column* configuration of the filter fed to the gadget.

Expected results:

The *Column* configuration applied by the gadget is the same used by the filter.

 !Screen Shot 2020-04-30 at 00.24.29.png|thumbnail! 

 !Screen Shot 2020-04-30 at 00.26.19.png|thumbnail! 

Actual results:

 !Screen Shot 2020-04-30 at 00.45.12.png|thumbnail! 

 !Screen Shot 2020-04-30 at 00.45.31.png|thumbnail! 

The *Column* configuration applied is defined by the user preferences instead.
fields.summary: Two Dimensional Filter Statistics gadget should display the results using the flter's column configuration.

fields.description:
When the Workflow Current Step Integrity Checker encounters an Issue that has an invalid status (another issue) it dies with a Null pointer and don't solve it.
 An issue can have an invalid status (one that does not exist for the workflow) if a Workflow Migration or Bulk Move died halfway through.
{panel:title=Workaround|borderStyle=dashed|borderColor=#3c78b5|titleBGColor=#3c78b5|bgColor=#e7f4fa}
This problem can be noticed when browsing/searching for issues, but finding the problematic issue often happens in the integrity checker
 * After running the integrity checker you should have the issue ID of the problematic issue
 * Go to that issue to view it
 * Clone it: (More actions > Clone)
(!) Note that comments are lost during the cloning operation.
 * Delete it: (More actions > Delete)

 OR

 * Change the Issue Type of the issue (the new type must have a different workflow)
 * Change it back to its original Issue Type

{panel}
fields.summary: Workflow Current Step Integrity Check dies when an issue has an invalid status

fields.description:
In [Best practices for IT teams using Jira Service Desk|https://confluence.atlassian.com/servicedeskserver/best-practices-for-it-teams-using-jira-service-desk-939926609.html], we mentioned that there are four workflows made available from the Marketplace.
{quote}We recommend starting with processes that are essential to your business goals. Jira Service Desk provides workflows for IT teams in our IT Service Desk project template. We created the following ITIL workflow add-ons, available in the Atlassian Marketplace:
 * [Change management for Jira Service Desk|https://marketplace.atlassian.com/1215175]
 * [Jira Service Desk incident management|https://marketplace.atlassian.com/1215191]
 * [Problem management for Jira Service Desk|https://marketplace.atlassian.com/1216179]
 * [Service requests for Jira Service Desk|https://marketplace.atlassian.com/1216202]{quote}
These four workflows are now bundled in Jira Service Desk, so it is helpful if this doco can be updated accordingly, as users may thought the workflows are different.
fields.summary: Update Best practices for IT teams using Jira Service Desk documentation

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
"About Jira" page can be accessed anonymously. This can expose the Jira application versions. Some customers might want to prevent this information from being available as it could be used to target other vulnerabilities specific to the version.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
Access <JIRA BASE URL>/secure/AboutPage.jspa anonymously

h3. Expected Results
The user gets redirected to log in

h3. Actual Results
The page is shown:
 !image-2020-04-29-16-59-12-723.png|thumbnail! 

Notes
This happens even if the public access is blocked using a flag in the dark features 

h3. Workaround
Create a block the URL from being accessed from the proxy side. Another option is doing it from Apache Tomcat: [How to block access to a specific URL at Tomcat|https://confluence.atlassian.com/kb/how-to-block-access-to-a-specific-url-at-tomcat-966668691.html]
fields.summary: About Jira page can be accessed anonymously

fields.description:

If this filter is used by an Agile Board, the filter can't be edited.

(i) This can be an intermittent behavior.

 # Create a new custom field of "Labels" type and name it "mylabels"
 # Do a search for "mylabels in(EMPTY)"
 # Save it as a new filter
 # Navigate to "Manage Filters"
 # Click on the saved filter

The filter and results are shown

500 Error page with the following error is shown:

java.lang.ClassCastException: com.atlassian.query.operand.EmptyOperand cannot be cast to com.atlassian.query.operand.SingleValueOperand
	at com.atlassian.jira.issue.search.searchers.transformer.CustomFieldLabelsSearchInputTransformer.getOperandValue(CustomFieldLabelsSearchInputTransformer.java:116)

	... 2 filtered

	at org.eclipse.gemini.blueprint.service.importer.support.internal.aop.ServiceInvoker.doInvoke(ServiceInvoker.java:56)
	at org.eclipse.gemini.blueprint.service.importer.support.internal.aop.ServiceInvoker.invoke(ServiceInvoker.java:60)
	at org.springframework.aop.framework.ReflectiveMethodInvocation.proceed(ReflectiveMethodInvocation.java:185)
	at org.springframework.aop.support.DelegatingIntroductionInterceptor.doProceed(DelegatingIntroductionInterceptor.java:136)
	at org.springframework.aop.support.DelegatingIntroductionInterceptor.invoke(DelegatingIntroductionInterceptor.java:124)

	at org.springframework.aop.framework.ReflectiveMethodInvocation.proceed(ReflectiveMethodInvocation.java:185)
	at org.eclipse.gemini.blueprint.service.importer.support.LocalBundleContextAdvice.invoke(LocalBundleContextAdvice.java:57)
	at org.springframework.aop.framework.ReflectiveMethodInvocation.proceed(ReflectiveMethodInvocation.java:185)
	at org.springframework.aop.support.DelegatingIntroductionInterceptor.doProceed(DelegatingIntroductionInterceptor.java:136)

(!) It also happens when adding other values to the search "mylabels in (test, otherlabel, EMPTY)"

h3. Workaround

The filter can be accessed when it is displayed on the Favourites bar on the left.
 To fix the filter do:

fields.description:
Currently, it is only possible to add a single user/group to a project role at a time.  Similarly, it is only possible to delete a single user/group from a role at a time.

It'd be useful for an ability for a bulk operation on this where multiple users/groups can be added or removed in a single request.
fields.summary: Ability to add or remove multiple project role actors

fields.description:
*Problem Statement:*

Enable the Jira Server Mobile app to turn to the auth_fallback URL upon first login attempt failure.
That’s useful when the infrastructure surrounding Jira relies on authentication types such as NTLM, which is not supported by the mobile app.
fields.summary: Add a fallback URL to use when the SAML auth does not work

fields.description:
*Problem Statement:*
Our Mobile app currently only support basic auth challenge inside WebView.
When using NTLM authentication it fails with the following error:
{code}
[2020-04-14 20:36:07 +0000]: AuthWebViewController.handle(challengeType:protectionSpace:completion:) challengeType: unsupported("NSURLAuthenticationMethodNTLM")
{code}

For organizations that rely on NTLM authentication workflows (OneLogin, for instance), this forbids the users to rely on the Mobile App.
fields.summary: Add support for NTLM authentication

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

For Mobile Apps, when SAML uses NTLM auth method, it fails with the following error message at the logs: 
{code}
 [2020-04-14 20:36:07 +0000]: AuthWebViewController.handle(challengeType:protectionSpace:completion:) challengeType: unsupported("NSURLAuthenticationMethodNTLM")).
{code}

Only basic auth is supported by mobile apps.

 

Our documentation at 
 [Jira Server mobile app|https://confluence.atlassian.com/jirasoftwareserver/jira-software-mobile-app-966063511.html] states:
{quote}*Login and authentication*

The app supports all common Jira user management configurations, including external user directories and SAML single sign-on. Users will need to sign in to use the app, even if your site allows anonymous access.
{quote}
But it does not mention that we do have restrictions for NTLM.
fields.summary: Add on our documentation that we do not support NTLM authentication

fields.description:
I would like to have the ability to resize text fields window size such as "Description" & "Comments". 

Currently, the fields will get enlarged vertically to some extent we would like it to be extended freely for both Horizontally as well as vertically. 

We use large images in the description and comment fields and we would like the field to either:

* Automatically resize according to the content E.g large image
* OR better yet, have a *Full page* button where it shows the field in a full-screen mode, something similar to video on youtube for example.

It would be great to have both options but we are okay with one.
fields.summary: Ability to resize text fields "Description" & "Comments"

fields.description:
As a Product Owner when I plan the future sprint, I should be able to re-organize the sprint based on the priority of the tickets in a click so that my time is efficiently used.

*Suggestions:*

Sprint drop down may have an option to re-arrange by priority

fields.description:
*Problem*
 As the owner of a Dashboard and filter, I would like to be able to select any user and group in the system.

 

*Description:*
 As the owner of a Dashboard and filter and respecting the 'Browse Users' global permission, I would like to be able to select one or more groups of users that can use that dashboard.
 This request is not the same as proposed by JRASERVER-15900 as we do not want to engage a Jira Administrator for this task.  Any user that does have both global permissions (to share and to browse users) should be able to share for any user and group.

 

*Steps to Reproduce*
 Have the following configuration:
 * group1 - member is user1, user1 has "Browse Users" and "Create Shared Objects" global permission
 * group2 - member is user2, user2 has "Browse Users" and "Create Shared Objects" global permission
 * Add a Custom field of type "Group Picker" on an issue type "bug" just to confirm that the user is able to select a group that the user is not a member of.

*How to reproduce:*
 * User1 creates an issue of type "bug", selecting group2 for the Custom field "Group Picker" (user1 has enough permission to select a group that he is not a member of);
 * User1 creates a new dashboard;
 * Grant editor permissions to group1;
 * User1 is able to edit dashboard (expected);
 * Select group to grant editor.

 

*Expected behavior*

User1 is able to select group2 from the dropdown list

 

*Observed behavior*

User1 can only see the group1 from the dropdown list, as user1 is not a member of group2.

 

*Workarounds:*

1. Add user1 also into the group2
 Caveats:
 a) Users will be added into groups that they do not belong to;
 b) May face the Issue https://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-70932

 

2. Ask the Administrator to share the dashboard
 Caveats:
 a) Few Jira Administrators too manage all User's requests;
 b) The Administrator would need to be added on all groups as issue https://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-15900 was not solved yet;
 c) After had added group1 and group2, may face the issue https://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-70932
fields.summary: As the owner of a Dashboard and filter, I would like to be able to select any user and group in the system.

fields.description:
There appears to have been a change in how Jira treats accented characters in custom fields and user names in between versions 7.0 and 8.6, as the customer is reporting a regression issue. 

If the user starts with the accented character, like "Ípek", the user picker does not detect it at all.
However, the same was working fine in 7.0.

Workaround:
Jira 7.0 was using old Java version java 1.8_11.
When using the same old Java version 1.8_11 with Jira 8.6 instead of Java version 1.8_202, it is possible to select the user.
fields.summary: User picker does not find users starting with a capital I with a dot (\u0130)

fields.description:
h3. Problem definition
A Jira Data Center node should request and obtain an index snapshot during its startup sequence, in case it doesn't have an index.

However, nothing will be done in the event of no other nodes being available, not having indexes of their own, or during a failure when creating an index snapshot. This causes the node to not have indexes until an admin manually signs in and requests a full re-index.

h3. Suggested Solution
Jira should have a configurable option to start a full re-index operation if no indexes are available, and no snapshots were received after a fixed amount of time.
fields.summary: As an admin I want Jira Data Center to automatically start a foreground reindex if no index exists and no snapshots are received after a fixed amount of time

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition
It is not desirable to have users accessing a node with corrupt or missing indexes, since any operations that rely on searches will not provide accurate results. Jira should expose a health check to allow for the load balancer to remove such nodes from rotation.

h3. Suggested Solution
The existing *{{/status}}* endpoint could return an error if indexes are missing or corrupt. This would allow the load balancer to know this node is not healthy and remove it from rotation.
fields.summary: As an admin I want Jira Data Center to expose a health check which fails if no indexes are available on the node

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition
In the Jira Server mobile app (IOS and Android), the mobile app has its own settings in terms of the event based notifications that end users receive.  These are separate from the project notifications schemes that are defined by a project administrator within Jira Server and Data Center editions.

h3. Suggested Solution
Have the mobile app honor the project notifications settings
OR
Provide some mechanism that allows Jira administrators to control the notifications that mobile app users receive about Jira.

h3. Why this is important
Several good reasons to do this:
# Mobile users will tend to get more and unexpected notifications than typically expected, and perhaps they do not realize they can control these from within the app itself
# Consistent messaging experience between platforms
# Administrators are expected to have control and manage what their end users see


h3. Workaround 
Currently mobile app users will have to manually adjust their own notifications levels from within the mobile app.
fields.summary: As a Jira admin, I want to be able to control the notifications mobile app users receive

fields.description: Currently, Jira only allows {{http/s}}, {{mailto}} and {{file}} URL schemes in Jira markup. It would be nice to have other arbitrary schemes to be available for deep linking from within the marked up text.
fields.summary: Allow deep linking in Jira advanced formatting markup

fields.description:
Currently, when we do bulk move for sub-task to another sub-task issue type we don't have the option to use  the same issue type selected and retaining the parent issues for each sub-task.

 

For example:

Here are the available Move -> To options shown, with each of the 15 issues showing it's parent link:
  -Project - no change
 -Issue Type - I want to Move Sub-Task To  Document(another sub-task issue type)
 -Select Parent Issue: - this shows the parent issue for EACH sub-task

User select the "Use the above project and issue type pair for all other combinations.", but there is no way to "retain" the existing parent issue.

All issues are moved to link to the single parent issue from the first sub-task.

 

Please have a feature to allow user to bulk move sub-task issue type without changing the parent issues
fields.summary: Bulk move subtasks to new type without changing the parent issues

fields.description:
Jira 8.8.x is compliant with WCAG 2.0 AA as mentioned in [Accessibility improvements in Jira|https://confluence.atlassian.com/jirasoftwareserver/accessibility-improvements-in-jira-993923419.html].

I would like to request future releases of Jira to be compliant with WCAG 2.1 AA and future versions of WCAG.
fields.summary: Request for WCAG 2.1 Compliance in Jira

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
User is trying to edit a worklog entry. The dialog box which opens when clicking on the edit button is ignoring the value in seconds and hence even if the dialog box is saved without editing anything, the time logged is changing.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
* Add a time spent value - 0.2525h to a ticket.
Screenshot1, Screenshot2
* Now click on the edit option from the worklog. The dialog box contains 'Time spent' as 15m. 15sec gets ignored by Jira.
Screenshot3
* Click on 'log' without changing anything. The logged time gets changed to 0.25h i.e, 15m.
Screenshot4

h3. Expected Results
Time spent value should have been pre-filled by 15.15m when clicked on edit worklog.
h3. Actual Results
Time spent value is ignoring the seconds and just has 15m while trying to edit the worklog.

h3. Workaround
Manually edit the Time spent to the correct value.
fields.summary: While editing a worklog, the seconds are being ignored by Jira

fields.description:
As a Jira Software user, I want the feature to Automatically close an Epic once all the Epic's children are done.
 
Currently, this is only available by using 3rd party plugin.
Example:

[Close an Epic when all the Issues Under that Epic are Closed|https://library.adaptavist.com/entity/close-an-epic-when-all-the-issues-under-that-epic-are-closed]
fields.summary: Automatically close an Epic once all the Epic's children are done.

fields.description: I'm frequently sending links to coworkers of the view I'm looking at in the Portfolio Roadmap view, but my filtering and view settings are not applied to their view when I send the link, so I have to guide them through how I got to the settings I'm using to look at it. It would be very nice if those settings were available in the address (e.g. PortfolioPlanView.jspa?id=1&sid=1*&Teams=none&groupBy=Team&etc=anotherSetting*)
fields.summary: Portfolio Filters and View Settings in URL

fields.description:
h4. Official Support Request
Currently, we do not have a clear statement of whether S3 is a supported file shared system for Data Center shared home. 

We need to make this clear to ensure this is a viable option for administrators to consider.
h4. Official Documentation

If S3 is officially supported, provide clear official documentation on the setup.
fields.summary: Add supportability statement for S3 as shared file system for Data Center

fields.description: By default, the optimizer sorts custom fields based on the performance impact they have on my Jira instance. Would like to be able to sort each column except Action and also add the Screens column same as is currently implemented on the Custom Field list page. Adding the Screens column would speed up the decision making for adding specific contexts.
fields.summary: Custom field optimizer should include sort and screens column

fields.description:
As a UX Designer, I use Jira to manage tasks across multiple projects. Some of the Jira boards are created and managed by PMs who assign cards to me, other Jira boards are managed by me. 

I want to have BOTH Kanban boards for those specific projects and an over arching Kanban board that has all of my projects AND I want them all on one page so that I don't have to jump in and out of multiple tabs in order to manage each board. 

A perfect example of this would be Favro. [https://www.favro.com/]. I'd highly suggest doing a competitive audit for user interactions and UI.
fields.summary: Creating a Kanban board that exists outside of a specific project.

fields.description:

h3. Steps to Reproduce

 eg. 
{code:Java|borderStyle=solid}
 curl -D- -u admin:admin -X POST --data "{\"comment\": \"I did some work here again.\",\"started\": \"2020-09-09T13:00:15.761+0000\",\"timeSpentSeconds\": 119}" -H "Content-Type: application/json" [http://localhost:8840/jira840/rest/api/2/issue/AAA-45/worklog]
{code}

 *Response*:
{code:Java|borderStyle=solid}
 {"self":"http://localhost:8840/jira840/rest/api/2/issue/11300/worklog/10401","author":{"self":"http://localhost:8840/jira840/rest/api/2/user?username=admin","name":"admin","key":"JIRAUSER10000","emailAddress":"test@test","avatarUrls":

{"48x48":"https://www.gravatar.com/avatar/c8d86ad5ed1add319e802f7f659df166?d=mm&s=48","24x24":"https://www.gravatar.com/avatar/c8d86ad5ed1add319e802f7f659df166?d=mm&s=24","16x16":"https://www.gravatar.com/avatar/c8d86ad5ed1add319e802f7f659df166?d=mm&s=16","32x32":"https://www.gravatar.com/avatar/c8d86ad5ed1add319e802f7f659df166?d=mm&s=32"}

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition
Currently, it is not possible to configure a specific Jira Data Center node to process certain jobs such as mail handlers. 

h3. Suggested Solution
Implement a feature to allow mail handler(s) to be assigned per node.

h3. Why this is important
Provide a better flexibility to the administrators in managing the data center clusters.
 
h3. Workaround 
No workaround at this point of time.
fields.summary: Implement a 'service node' for Jira Data Center

fields.description:
I'm using Portfolio to track resources, and in some cases there are some tickets that group together the work for multiple people, or the best I can say about an issue is that these 4 people are working on this. I would love to be able to have multiple assignees, but in the absence of being able to do that, having a separate multi-user-picker field to track this would be very helpful.

It looks like this isn't supported though, in my experience and in the docs ([https://confluence.atlassian.com/jiraportfolioserver/custom-fields-967895171.html]):

The following custom field types are supported:
 * checkbox
 * date picker
 * +_*user picker (single user)*_+
 * number
 * radio button

 * label
 * single-choice select
 * multiple-choice select
 * single-line text
 * URL _(read-only)_

I would love for this custom field type to be supported by Portfolio. Even better, if I could "Group by..." this custom field and have it show me all of the items that each user is connected to in that field, even better.
fields.summary: Support for multi-user fields as Portfolio custom fields
Parameterize the amount of Threads for web hook processing

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition
Incorrecty links in the Database expand macro for MS SQL server in the instalation documentation for all versions:
- https://confluence.atlassian.com/adminjiraserver/installing-jira-applications-on-windows-938846835.html#

In the table under the section *"Is your database set up and ready to use?"* under the *tell me more* drop down, The Documentation has the following two incorrect links on the AND and  SQL Server text:
{quote}
Set up your database before you begin. Step-by-step guides are available for PostgreSQL, Oracle, MySQL 5.6, MySQL 5.7, [and|https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/DOC/Database+Setup+For+MySQL] [SQL Server.|https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/ADMINJIRASERVER086/Connecting+Jira+applications+to+SQL+Server+2012]
{quote}
The *"and"* is linked to the Confluence MySQL Database set documentation:
* https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/DOC/Database+Setup+For+MySQL
The SQL Server is linked to the SQL Server 2012 documentation (Noting 2012 is deprecated in 8.8 and later) 

h3.NOTE:
We have already corrected the "and" link and the  MS SQL Server link in the Jira 8.8 document version updating the SQL server version to MSSQL 2016 documentation

AND We have updated the "and" link in the 8.7 documentation BUT the corrections still need to be made to the 8.6 and earlier docs

h3. Suggested Solution
At a minimum every doc version needs to be reviewed and have the incorrect "AND" link to the confluence database setup documentation removed as well as the rest of the compatible DB version links checked and compared to the supported platforms documentation to verify the correct DB versions are listed

Overall adding in a individualized database version link for each database type, in each documentation version will become unmanageable as database versions become EOL and deprecated noting the incorrect link to the 2012 version previously listed in the 8.8 doc version that we have since corrected edits viewable in Page history

I recomend updating this to a single Link to the *[Connecting Jira applications to a database|https://confluence.atlassian.com/adminjiraserver/connecting-jira-applications-to-a-database-938846850.html]*  documentation page that has the detailed  steps for each supported database type on the noted application version

EXE text:
{quote}
Set up your database before you begin. Step-by-step guides are available for your Database version in [Connecting Jira applications to a database|https://confluence.atlassian.com/adminjiraserver/connecting-jira-applications-to-a-database-938846850.html]
{quote}
fields.summary: Wrong Links in Jira Server Installation Documentation

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
REST API for Add user to group returns error 400 instead of 404 when the user does not exist. According to the documentation of [JIRA 8.5.3|https://docs.atlassian.com/software/jira/docs/api/REST/8.5.3/#api/2/group-addUserToGroup] when the user or group does not exist, an error 404 should be returned.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
Do a POST request to the endpoint /rest/api/2/group/user sending a body with an invalid use like this:{code} {"name":"not.existing.user"}{code}

h3. Expected Results
As per documentation, "STATUS 404 Returned if the requested group was not found or requested user was not found.".

h3. Actual Results
A message 400 is returned:  !screenshot-1.png|thumbnail! 

h3. Workaround
Currently there is no known workaround for this behavior. A workaround will be added here when available
fields.summary: REST API for Add user to group returns error 400 instead of 404 when the user does not exist

fields.summary: DLL hijacking in Jira Server & JSD via Tomcat - CVE-2019-20419

fields.description:
This issue exists to document that a security improvement in the way that Jira Server and Data Center use velocity templates has been implemented.

The way in which velocity templates were used in Atlassian Jira Server and Data Center prior to version 8.8.0 allowed remote attackers to gain remote code execution if they were able to exploit a server side template injection vulnerability.

*Affected versions:*
 * version < 8.8.0

*Fixed versions:*
 * 8.8.0

*Workaround for previous versions:*
You use this workaround at your own discretion.
{quote}
1. Download [Jira 8.12|https://product-downloads.atlassian.com/software/jira/downloads/atlassian-jira-software-8.12.3.zip] as zip and extract it’s content
2. [Localize your Jira instance installation directory|https://confluence.atlassian.com/adminjiraserver/jira-application-installation-directory-938847745.html]
3. Shutdown your Jira instance
4. Go to the _<jira_installation_dir>/atlassian-jira/WEB-INF/lib/_ directory
5. Remove files: _velocity-htmlsafe-3.0.0.jar_ and _velocity-1.6.4-atlassian-7.jar_
6. Copy files _velocity-htmlsafe-3.1.1.jar_ and _velocity-1.6.4-atlassian-21.jar_ from downloaded Jira 8.12 to current directory. They are found in the _<Jira_8_12_dir>/atlassian-jira/WEB-INF/lib/_ directory
7. Go to the _<jira_installation_dir>/atlassian-jira/WEB-INF/classes_ directory
8. Replace the velocity.properties and velocity-static.properties files with their counterparts from the downloaded Jira 8.12
9. Start your Jira instance again
{quote}
fields.summary: Make use of Secure Introspector in Velocity Templates - CVE-2019-20409

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition

At this time, Extended Project Administrators are able to edit the workflow in use by a project by adding new statuses and transitions; however, they are unable to adjust the various properties of the statuses and transitions.

It'd be beneficial to allow Extended Project Administrators to designate specific transitions and statuses to set resolution values in, without necessarily having to grant permissions to modify post-functions.

h3. Suggested Solution
 
Implement a configuration for specific transitions to allow resolution fields to be set by Extended Project Administrators
fields.summary: Allow Extended Project Administrators to set resolution field on workflow transitions

The way in which velocity templates were used in Atlassian Jira Server and Data Center prior to version 8.8.1 allowed remote attackers to achieve remote code execution via insecure deserialization, if they were able to exploit a server side template injection vulnerability.

*Affected versions:*

*Fixed versions:*

2. [Localize your Jira instance installation directory|https://confluence.atlassian.com/adminjiraserver/jira-application-installation-directory-938847745.html]
3. Shutdown your Jira instance
4. Go to the _<jira_installation_dir>/atlassian-jira/WEB-INF/lib/_ directory
5. Remove files: _velocity-htmlsafe-3.0.0.jar_ and _velocity-1.6.4-atlassian-7.jar_
6. Copy files _velocity-htmlsafe-3.1.1.jar_ and _velocity-1.6.4-atlassian-21.jar_ from downloaded Jira 8.12 to current directory. They are found in the _<Jira_8_12_dir>/atlassian-jira/WEB-INF/lib/_ directory
7. Go to the _<jira_installation_dir>/atlassian-jira/WEB-INF/classes_ directory
8. Replace the velocity.properties and velocity-static.properties files with their counterparts from the downloaded Jira 8.12.3

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
REST API for Add actor users returns success (200) even if the user doesn't exist. In the documentation for [JIRA 8.5.3|https://docs.atlassian.com/software/jira/docs/api/REST/8.5.3/#api/2/project/{projectIdOrKey}/role-addActorUsers]

h3. Steps to Reproduce
Do a POST request to the endpoint "/rest/api/2/project/<projectIdOrKey>/role/<id>" sending a body with an invalid use like this: 
{code} {"user":["not.existing.user"]}
{code}

h3. Expected Results
The documentation indicates "The project must exist and the user must have permission to view it.". If the user indicated in the body does not exist, the expectation is that there would be an error 404 as indicated in the documentation: "STATUS 404 Returned if the actor could not be added to the project role".

h3. Actual Results
A message 200 (success) is returned.
The below exception is thrown in the xxxxxxx.log file:
 !image-2020-04-21-23-02-54-851.png|thumbnail! 
h3. Workaround
 Currently there is no known workaround for this behavior. A workaround will be added here when available
fields.summary: REST API for Add actor users returns success (200) even if the user doesn't exist

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition
Currently, the password policy does not apply when users opt for the 'Forgot your password?' link which sends them an email to reset password. For example, users can re-use the existing password. 

h3. Suggested Solution
Implement the password policy when user opt for the 'Forgot your password?' 

h3. Why this is important
The password policy should be respected in all occasion

h3. Workaround 
No workaround at the moment. Consider third-party app (add-on/plugin) that offers password policy.
fields.summary: Implement password policy when user resets password via the 'Forgot your password?' link

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
We had an outage on a Jira instance running JSD 3.16.11 today which appeared to be caused by requests to the `/jira/rest/internal/2/user/mention/search` endpoint. 

Looking at request times for different queries, those that do NOT contain a query string appear to be significantly slower. 

Requests with a query string:
 !Screen Shot 2020-04-20 at 3.57.16 PM.png|thumbnail! 

Requests WITHOUT a query string:
 !Screen Shot 2020-04-20 at 3.57.46 PM.png|thumbnail! 

Note the scale change - the longest with a query string was 13s, the _shortest_ without was 28s, with longest over 60s 

h3. Examples:
# With a query string, took 0.14s: {{/jira/rest/internal/2/user/mention/search?issueKey=KEY-5678&maxResults=10&query=il&_=1587494420052}}, (referrer is /jira/browse/KEY-5678)
# Without a query string, took 62s: {{/jira/rest/internal/2/user/mention/search?issueKey=KEY-1234&maxResults=10&_=1587407226218}} (referrer is /jira/browse/KEY-1234?filter=-1)

h3. Steps to Reproduce
I am not sure what this endpoint is - I went into the referrer (for a lot of them this was filter=-1) and clicked around but was not able to hit that endpoint with anything I did. 

h3. Expected Results
Searches return promptly with no performance impact. 

h3. Actual Results
This actually caused an outage for us due to a spike in CPU which seems connected to GC activity. 

CPU spike:
 !Screen Shot 2020-04-20 at 2.46.58 PM.png|thumbnail! 

Unhealthy hosts:
 !Screen Shot 2020-04-20 at 2.47.14 PM.png|thumbnail! 

Increased request latency:
 !Screen Shot 2020-04-20 at 2.47.32 PM.png|thumbnail! 

New Relic showing that this endpoint is the slowest:
 !Screen Shot 2020-04-20 at 1.53.54 PM.png|thumbnail! 

CPU activity by thread showing that GC is the main consumer of CPU. NB: we got the threads long after the request returned/timed out - it is likely still processing in the back end at this point:
 !Screen Shot 2020-04-20 at 4.29.43 PM.png|thumbnail! 

h3. Workaround
Currently there is no known workaround for this behavior. A workaround will be added here when available
fields.summary: Requests to `/jira/rest/internal/2/user/mention/search` where the parameters do NOT include a query are very slow

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

Users are unable to edit a dashboard if the dashboard is shared with multiple groups.
h3. Steps to Reproduce

Have the following configuration:
 * group1 - member is user1
 * group2 - member is user2

How to reproduce:
 # Create new dashboard
 # Grant editor permissions to group1
 # User1 is able to edit dashboard (expected)
 # Grant editor permissions to group2 OR to user2 individually
 # User2 is unable to edit dashboard (not expected). User2 is able to view the dashboard but the "Edit dashboard", "Add Gadget" and "Edit layout" options are missing.

!Edit Dashboard missing.png|thumbnail!

It seems that only the group permissions takes precedence while any subsequent group/users are ignored.
h3. Expected Results

User 2 should be able to edit the dashboard, as the user is a member of "group2" which has edit permissions.
h3. Actual Results

Members of the "group2" group cannot edit the dashboard
h3. Workaround
 # Grant edit permissions to a single group and make sure all the relevant users that need to edit the dashboard are part of this group
 # Grant permissions to individual users manually.
fields.summary: Sharing dashboard with multiple groups caused users to lost ability to edit the dashboard

fields.description: Currently, The resolution time and date are set automatically based on when the ticket has gone into the resolution status. This can sometimes throw off reporting if we are going off the time the ticket was first resolved changes due to repeat reopening or errors in the database. We would like the option to manually change the resolution timestamp.
fields.summary: Have option to manually set the resolution

fields.description:
Currently, Jira (7.13 / 8.8) doesn't offer a safe & supported mechanism for programmatically installing or upgrading Atlassian Apps (JSW, JSD, Portfolio) or 3rd party Apps that could be used in an automation of some sort.

Alternatives vary from [copying the installed-plugins folder from a temp instance|https://community.atlassian.com/t5/Answers-Developer-Questions/Deploying-plugins-bundled-as-OBR-automatically/qaq-p/524825] that's been manually installed/upgraded or unpacking jar/OBRs into that folder — yet each App has it's own particularities (like not all jars from within obr/dependencies should be copied, etc).
fields.summary: Allow Apps to be installed programmatically without human interaction

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

Resolution is empty after moving an issue to status closed using the move feature.

 

Without a resolution set, the resolution date also is missing. In that case, the issue data is inconsistent and you are not able to run reports based on it.

From our point of view that allows unwanted behavior. Is there any way to prevent this or to force to set the resolution on moving issues, too?
h3. Steps to Reproduce

1. open a ticket
2. select more -> move
3. you see the following screen and set "new issue type" to an issue type that uses another workflow (see firstscreen.jpg)
4. click "next"
5. since the target workflow does not contain current status "Einspielbereit (Prod)", Jira asks for the status to be set. If the user selects "closed" as new status, the ticket is closed (see secondscreen.jpg)
6. click "next"
7. click "next" again
=> the issue type will be moved to the new issue type and status will be set to "closed" but: the resolution field is not set. Expected Results
h3. Expected Results

The issue type will be moved to the new issue type and status will be set to "closed"  with the correct resolution state.
h3. Actual Results

Setting the resolution field is triggered in all our workflow transitions to target status "closed" (see workflow1.jpg & resolveissuescreen.jpg). Obviously with "move", the issue type and the status are set, but the workflow rules of the target issue type are ignored.
h3. Workaround

No workaround
fields.summary: issue type will be moved to the new issue type and status will be set to "closed" but : the resolution field is not set.

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

When users search for issues, they can accidentally assign the issue to themselves using keyboard shortcuts amoung other hotkey tasks. 

However, this behavior results in issues being assigned unexpectedly as no confirmation is prompted by the hotkey action. 
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Look at a list of issues
 # Press the 'I' keyboard shortcut
 # The issue will be assigned to you with no warning. 

h3. Expected Results

Provide a prompt confirming that the user wants to assign the issue to themselves. 
h3. Workaround

Disable the hotkeys with the following steps:
 * Ensure you are logged in and open the [Keyboard Shortcuts dialog box|https://confluence.atlassian.com/jiracoreserver074/using-keyboard-shortcuts-921047262.html] 
 * At the bottom of the Keyboard Shortcuts dialog box, click Disable Keyboard Shortcuts

(?) You can also disable or re-enable keyboard shortcuts by editing the Preferences section of your user profile. See Managing your user profile for more information.
fields.summary: Add confirmation before keyboard shortcut action is taken.

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition
Searching archived issues only allows for the following filters:
* Archived date
* Archiver user
* Project
* Issue type
* Reporter

Therefore, it is not possible to perform a text search on the issue's comments, or to search the issue summary or any other field.

h3. Suggested Solution
Either implement the possibility of adding new columns to the search, or preferrably mimic the current JQL search capabilities as much as possible.
fields.summary: As an administrator I want to have more flexibility when searching archived issues

fields.description:
When a batch notification is enabled in a system, the user may not get the notification precisely at the time set i.e, at 2 mins,5 mins or 10 mins.
There will be a delay of ~5 mins sometimes depending on when the even was created in Jira.

Suppose an event is triggered at 6:37 PM and there is a job that runs every 5 mins building the batched notification starting at 6:00 PM, then this event will be picked up at 6:40 PM and sent after 10 mins. In addition to this, the job will wait for an additional minute for the mail queue service to complete. There could be delays in relaying the information on SMTP as well. So put together, the mail will actually reach the customer only around 6:53 PM while the user expects it by 6:47 PM.

We should document it within the Batch notification KB article on this behavior.
fields.summary: Documentation on Jira Batch Notification

fields.description: When using the official Slack connector it is possible to see the list of Slack accounts connected and confirm/revoke access. It would be good to be able to do this in an automated fashion through REST API.
fields.summary: Add REST API to Slack connector to be able to manage connections.

fields.description:
+As-is situation:+

Quick filters can be applied cumulatively (AND logic). Sometimes this is not wanted as this forces the user to de-select a previously selected Quick filter entry and then only a different Quick filter will work as expected. 

+Proposed improvement:+

Introduce a new attribute/setting that allows to control the behavior of each Quick filter.

Default behaviour would be as-is.

An alternative behaviour would automatically reset other Quick filters selected by the user and only the newly selected Quick filter would apply.
fields.summary: Enhance Quick filters to work also exclusively/reset already selected Quick filters (when clicked)

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

The Jira Server REST API for [getting an Assignable user|https://docs.atlassian.com/software/jira/docs/api/REST/7.8.1/#api/2/user-getUser] indicates that when a user is not found, it would return error 404. Instead it is returning a 200 OK message when no users are found.
h3. Steps to Reproduce

Perform a REST API call using the Get Assignable User Aendpoint, something like
{code:java}
http://localhost:8080/rest/api/2/user/assignable/search?username=InexistentUser&issueKey=SCRUM01-01{code}
h3. Expected Results

If the user does not exist (or if there are no users that match the user search criteria), the documentation for the REST API indicates that there should be an Error 404.
h3. Actual Results

When no user is returned, the response is a successful 200 OK message, with an empty response:
 !image-2020-04-16-17-33-28-791.png!

It is not clear if the behavior is correct and the documentation is incorrect or vice versa.
h3. Workaround

Currently there is no known workaround for this behavior. A workaround will be added here when available
fields.summary: Using REST API to get Assignable user does not return error 400 as indicated in documentation when user is not found

fields.description:
I know there are some Apps and plugins already, but all independent.

 

This Ticket I'd like to raise to *combine* CONFSERVER-51760 and JRASERVER-43462 as I'd like to request a Gamification-System which is cross-platform.

We use Jira and Confluence and I do not want to have independent leadership-bards, as both our platforms are used by the same people and are really close together.

So I'd like one Leadership Board, where a resolved ticket in Jira or a Comment in Confluence is doing the same badge-level.
fields.summary: Gamification with badges

fields.description:
h3. Summary

Mistakenly removing a mandatory field from issue creation's screen does not show any error. 
 The field needs to be at least in one of the creation screens otherwise it will cause failures in creating issues afterwards.  
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # select any software development prject, Go to project setting -> screens
 # Go to any screen scheme (lets say "bug screen scheme")
 # Remove "Summary" field
 # select "issues" from left menu bar
 # Try creating an issue

h3. Expected Results 

Once clicking on update (step #4), an error/warning should prompt telling that the mandatory field needs to be at least in one of the screens to be able to create issues.
h3. Actual Results

When clicked "create" at the bottom of the window and nothing happened, no warning that something is missing
fields.summary: Removing mandatory field from all screens should either be prohibited or show warnings.

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

User is not able to add new fields to the tab because Jira returns this error:
 !image-2020-04-15-15-59-02-982.png|thumbnail! 
 and in the log file, you can find *IndexOutOfBoundsException*. Full stack trace can be found in _Actual Results_ section.

This is because Jira uses the sequence number of a tab as an index in the ArrayList data structure. Furthermore, all actions on the *fieldscreentab* database table are not performed in a transaction or using a lock - the last operation always wins.

As a result, concurrent modifications of the tabs can corrupt their sequences number due to a race condition. If one of the operations is a delete operation, one of the tabs can stay with the old sequence number causing IndexOutOfBoundsException.
h3. Steps to Reproduce

The easiest way to reproduce the problem is by using a debugger with breakpoints.

This is one of the possible reproduction scenarios. Those steps imitate two users who are performing DELTE and UPDATE operation at the same time. 
 1. Set up the breakpoints in those three places:
{code:java}
com.atlassian.jira.issue.fields.screen.DefaultFieldScreenStore#getFieldScreenTabs
com.atlassian.jira.issue.fields.screen.DefaultFieldScreenStore#updateFieldScreenTab
com.atlassian.jira.issue.fields.screen.DefaultFieldScreenStore#removeFieldScreenTab {code}
2. Create 3 tabs
 !image-2020-04-15-16-22-58-239.png|thumbnail! 
 Your database sequence numbers should look like that:
 !image-2020-04-15-16-30-13-200.png|thumbnail! 
 3. In two different threads perform two different operations:
 * remove *Tab0* and skip all actions in debugger until you will land in the *removeFieldScreenTab*() method
 * then swap *Tab1* with *Tab2* and skip all actions in debugger until you will land in the
 * *updateFieldScreenTab*() method
 !image-2020-04-15-16-23-17-018.png|thumbnail!

4. Perform all operations in the thread which removed the *Tab0*
 5. Perform all operations in the thread which swapped the tabs *Tab1* and *Tab2*

Your database sequences should look like this
 !image-2020-04-15-16-23-41-423.png|thumbnail!

 
h3. Expected Results

The actions completed without any errors
 !image-2020-04-15-16-24-37-903.png|thumbnail!
h3. Actual Results

An error message "The Jira server was contacted but has returned an error response. We are unsure of the result of this operation." is displayed:

 !screenshot-1.png|thumbnail! 
h3. Workaround

Swap already existed tabs and their sequence number should be recalculated.
 OR
Follow the steps in this [KB|https://confluence.atlassian.com/jirakb/adding-a-field-to-a-screen-tab-throws-java-lang-indexoutofboundsexception-947179250.html]

fields.description:
Currently when we set the "email visibility option to Hidden" then email id of the users are not visible but in the scenario where the user's username also happens to be an email address it still shows the email address of the user 

Please check the screenshot below :

As per suggestion from a customer he would like few modifications in this feature which are as below :
1. Don't show the username in brackets if email == username, when email setting is hidden.

2. Add an option to exclude auto-generated users where username is an email address from showing up in auto-completion.

3. Give auto-generated users a random username and allow them to login with an email address as username.
fields.summary: Hide users email address for security or privacy concern
